<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 1"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Elven Aloofness](/Feats.aspx?ID=1408) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Elf" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=58" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Advanced Player's Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=39) pg. 43 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

</column>

---

As much as you might care for them, you've come to terms with the ephemeral nature of non-elves, and it makes their threats feel less troublesome. If a non-elf rolls a failure on a check to [Coerce](/Actions.aspx?ID=52) you using [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7), it gets a critical failure instead (and thus can't try to Coerce you again for 1 week). When a non-elf attempts to [Demoralize](/Actions.aspx?ID=53) you, you become temporarily immune for 1 day, instead of 10 minutes.
name: Elven Aloofness
